post: I would point out that the threads of the sample from the C14 area were given to Rogers by prof. Gonella (the Archbishop of Turin’s scientific adviser); Gonella died in 2007, two years after Rogers’ paper, and he has never denied the Rogers’ version: Gonella excised the threads from the centre of the radiocarbon sample A. For Episcopalian: please note that Jull in his paper writes “radiocarbon samples” in inverted commas; Nickell in the article linked by william does the same: coincidence?.
title: Outstanding Response to Recent Carbon Dating Paper
